marketNews.title: Gold Prices Reach All-Time High, Breaking US$3,500/oz
marketNews.content:
Gold price in the spot market recorded a new all-time high of 3,508.73 US dollars per troy ounce during intraday trading on Tuesday 2 September 2025, later weakening to 3,483.76 US dollars per troy ounce in the afternoon. This represents a 2.56 % increase over the past week and a 32.7 % rise since the start of the year (YTD), surpassing the previous all-time high recorded in April 2025.

The rally is driven by: 1) strengthening expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut; 2) continued de-dollarisation trends; and 3) persistent geopolitical and macro-economic uncertainty.

According to the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of a US rate cut at the September 2025 meeting rose to 91.8 % today, up from 87.8 % a week earlier. Investor concerns about the Fed’s independence – after President Trump’s pressure on the Fed chair and the dismissal issue of Fed official Lisa Cook – have also eroded confidence in the US dollar. Investors also fear that inflation could rise if a US rate cut is implemented due to political pressure. According to a senior commodity strategist at ANZ, Daniel Hynes, demand for gold is currently elevated by investor worries about inflation risks from a rate cut.

Amid the gold strength, the US Dollar Index (DXY) has weakened 9.3 % YTD to 98.37 on Tuesday 2 September.

tickerNews.title: Gold Miner Stock Rally on Higher Prices
tickerNews.content: Penguatan harga emas mendorong rally harga saham emiten-emiten emas pada hari ini, seperti $ANTM (+8,44%), $BRMS (+10,29%), $MDKA (+3,21%), $PSAB (+0,84%), $ARCI (+11,18%), dan $HRTA (+4,29%).

tickerNews.title: KLBF Plans Share Buyback up to Rp250 Billion
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma plans to conduct a share buyback with a funding allocation of up to 250 billion rupiah during the period 4 September–3 December 2025. The company did not disclose the number of shares to be repurchased nor the execution price. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, following the relaxation granted by the OJK to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Chairman Purchases 62,500 Shares
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia’s President Director, Jahja Setiaatmadja, purchased 62,500 BBCA shares at an average price of 7,975 rupiah per share on 1 September 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 498 million rupiah. After this transaction, Jahja’s direct ownership in BBCA remains roughly unchanged at around 0.03 %.

tickerNews.title: BNGA Reports July 2025 Bank-Only Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga reported net profit for the bank-only segment of 443 billion rupiah in July 2025 (down 22 % YoY, down 28 % MoM). This caused the 7-month-to-25 bank-only net profit to fall to 3.8 trillion rupiah (down 2 % YoY), equal to 54 % of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 57 % in 7M-24). The profit decline was driven by a 4 % YoY drop in Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) and a 236 % YoY increase in provision expenses. PPOP also fell 7 % YoY during 7M25, although the 7M25 net profit only slipped slightly (-2 % YoY) thanks to a 25 % YoY reduction in provision expenses. Credit growth slowed to 4 % YoY in July 2025 (vs. 6 % YoY in June 2025, 7 % YoY in March 2025).

tickerNews.title: CITA Announces New Share Issuance for Aluminium Smelter Project
tickerNews.content: Cita Mineral Investindo announced that its subsidiary, PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry, issued new shares worth approximately 1.9 trillion rupiah to support the development of an aluminium smelter project. In this corporate action, CITA injected about 237 billion rupiah, maintaining its ownership in PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry at 12.5 %. Other shareholders of PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry include the subsidiary of Alamtri Minerals Indonesia (ADMR) and PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium, holding 65 %, and Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. holding 22.5 %. PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium and Aumay Mining also participated in the new share issuance according to their respective ownership percentages.

tickerNews.title: NISP Reports July 2025 Bank-Only Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP reported net profit for the bank-only segment of 445 billion rupiah in July 2025 (down 49 % YoY, up 2 % MoM), resulting in a 7-month-to-25 bank-only net profit of 3 trillion rupiah (down 8 % YoY versus a 7M25 increase of 7 % YoY). The July decline was caused by a 71 % YoY drop in non-interest income due to a high-base effect from investment earnings (2 billion rupiah vs. 527 billion rupiah in July 2024). Meanwhile, the 7M25 net profit was pressured by provision expenses of 66 billion rupiah (versus a reversal of provisions of 491 billion rupiah in 7M24). Net Interest Margin fell to 4.1 % in 7M25 (vs. 4.6 % in 7M24).

tickerNews.title: DSSA and First Gen Geothermal JV Targeted for Q4 2025
tickerNews.content: Business reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa (DSSA) and PT First Gen Geothermal Indonesia target their joint venture in the geothermal business to be established in Q4 2025. The JV will be owned 50 % by DSSA’s subsidiary PT DSSR Daya Mas Sakti and 50 % by First Gen. The JV will focus on development and management of geothermal resources with a combined capacity of about 440 MW across six fields located in West Java, Flores, Jambi, West Sumatra, and Central Sulawesi.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Diversifies into Mining Services via PPRE
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that PT PP (PTPP) will diversify its business into mining services, particularly in mining infrastructure, through PP Presisi (PPRE). The company’s corporate secretary, Joko Raharjo, said the focus will be on winning new contracts from large mining license holders, both state-owned and private. In 1H25, the mining services segment generated revenue of approximately 106.7 billion rupiah, about 1.6 % of total PTPP revenue for the period.

tickerNews.title: PYFA Announces Exclusive Partnership with Genewel Co.
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma (PYFA) announced an exclusive partnership with Genewel Co. Ltd., a South Korean company known for medical biomaterials, anti-adhesion agents, and advanced wound-care technologies. Through this partnership, PYFA obtains exclusive distribution rights for Genewel’s flagship products—including Medifoam, Welpass, and Guardix-SG—in Indonesia and Southeast Asian countries. The exclusivity covers full authority for registration, import, marketing, sales, and sub-distributor network management in the designated territories.

tickerNews.title: DOID Issues Bonds up to Rp1.4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: BUMA International Group (DOID), through its subsidiary PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama, will issue bonds up to 1.4 trillion rupiah. Proceeds will be used to partially repay senior US-dollar notes, finance capex for operational expansion, and support working-capital needs. The bonds will be issued in three series with tenors of 370 days, 3 years, and 5 years; interest rates have not been disclosed. The issuance received an A+ rating from Pefindo and Fitch Ratings. The public offering is scheduled for 30 September–2 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI Rises to 50.5 in August 2025
tickerNews.content: S&P Global reported that China’s manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) rose to 50.5 in August 2025 (vs. 49.5 in July 2025), surpassing the consensus expectation of 49.5 and marking the highest level since March 2025. Output grew as new orders and purchasing activity increased, while foreign demand eased. Nevertheless, manufacturers remain cautious on employment, with staffing contracting for five consecutive months. Business sentiment rose to a five-month high, supported by optimism about economic improvement and sales growth from expansion plans.
